review_text: This COULD be great…..But it only allows you to do an activity three times before forcing you to select another activity again. So, if your child is on the letter writing activity, they can write three letters and that’s it and then it tells them to select another activity. You can select the same activity again, but you can’t just continue on without restating the activity. Why in the world would it do this? It prevents kids from being able to focus for more than 1-2 minutes at a time. My child immediately hated this after it made her pick an activity when she was focused and happily writing letters. Now she doesn’t use it.

review_text: Can’t Add Every Name.The toy is fun and educational but one major complaint for us. My kiddos name contains three letters in succession that also spell a “bad word.” The tablet won’t allow you to type those letters even in the context of another word. This results in the name function not working because we aren’t able to enter the spelling of his name due to those three letters being in the middle of the name. I understand having a “filter” option to not enter certain words but not letting you type anything that even contains those letters is frustrating.

review_text: Doesn’t work.The media could not be loaded.I purchased this as a Christmas gift at the end of September. When you have multiple kids you know the struggle  of buying everything at once so I start a few months out. Anyway, bought this and it sat in the box until Christmas morning. We opened it and little one was excited to play with it but the top left corner of screen doesn’t work and the screen doesn’t rotate and lock when I laptop mode, making that function useless. Of course, it’s past the return date but it wasn’t opened until Christmas. The leapfrog company said there’s a 90 day warranty but it doesn’t apply because of purchase date. What’s the difference in sitting in my closet and sitting on the shelf? I have photo proof that it was opened on Christmas morning. Anyway- this is the last leapfrog product we will ever purchase. The company’s customer service is awful.

review_text: Laptop and tablet functionality not working (3 weeks).I got this for my 2 years old son by September 1st, 2024 and he loved it. review_text: Impossible to see, completely useless although nice concept.The screen is completely unviewable, first the screen is very reflective which makes it catch light and have high glare, second the contrast of the screen (black LCD over blue-lit background) is so poor that you cannot see anything anyways beyond some vague shapes, third the viewing angle is non-existent - if you move 1 degree up/left/down/right it also completely removes visibility.  Beyond this, the actual concept is nice with 2-in-1 laptop/tablet, children email writing, and songs, but there's not much here that you wouldn't find in almost any other children's toy (maybe like 30-40 permutations of songs/activities/etc) but since you can't see anything anyways, it's much more frustrating for the child than fun and you'll get alot of anger/crying with it.  Definitely DO NOT RECOMMEND.
_text: Impossible to see, completely useless although nice concept.The screen is completely unviewable, first the screen is very reflective which makes it catch light and have high glare, second the contrast of the screen (black LCD over blue-lit background) is so poor that you cannot see anything anyways beyond some vague shapes, third the viewing angle is non-existent - if you move 1 degree up/left/down/right it also completely removes visibility.  Beyond this, the actual concept is nice with 2-in-1 laptop/tablet, children email writing, and songs, but there's not much here that you wouldn't find in almost any other children's toy (maybe like 30-40 permutations of songs/activities/etc) but since you can't see anything anyways, it's much more frustrating for the child than fun and you'll get alot of anger/crying with it.  Definitely DO NOT RECOMMEND.

review_text: Defective product.The media could not be loaded.Read instructions, replaced batteries, and touch screen doesn't work in tablet mode.  There is no touch screen functionality in any of the modes.  It appears to have an air bubble or possibly water under the plastic covering the screen.  There is no removable protective film.I'm also upset that I have to go out of my way to drive to an Amazon return site/partner.  There isn't even a replacement option.  I think my daughter would have enjoyed this but unfortunately I can't recommend the product after this experience.

review_text: Don't waste your money.My son (3) was given this by a family member for Christmas. He was quite excited for it but he became incredibly frustrated by the "messages" feature. The thing asks him to reply to "violet" or "scout" by typing a response. My son can read and write so this is great for him in theory. But the feature is half assed. There is no space button! My son was actually in tears trying to figure out how to put a space between words. Anyone with a toddler knows how easily frustrated they get. I do not blame him here. Why include such a feature if it doesn't work?

review_text: Do NOT buy this sheet!!!!!!!.So look right…... I buy everything before hand.. and I’ve bought this mess on May 20th for my son’s bday on June 21st (keep reading). The return window closed on June 19th (trust me on this.. you’ll want to keep reading!!!!).. the darn screen does the same thing all the videos show up above.. it falls backwards.. this is complete junk I promise.. and they have the audacity to have the contrast level on the screen be horrendous AF, okay.. there’s not making the lettering on the screen any darker (but.. you’re almost there.. keep reading.. or risk being annoyed AF with this purchase)!!! Soooooooo.. now.. that I’m stuck with this piece of trash… because we didn’t open it until after the return window! Now, mind you, I would’ve opened it prior, if it was for myself, but my 3 year old is obsessed with opening all boxes from friggin Amazon (go figure 😡) and we didn’t want to ruin his joy.. soooooo, all in all.. to make a long story short … he bangs this *sheet* on the floor (all day and all night) because he’s *pieced* the heck off, that it’s trash and he complains to me about the screen not working properly🤬 because he knows it’s trash and it annoys him.. which leads him to annoy me!You are free to buy this mess on a hope and prayer that the reviews might be a hit or miss and your luck is destined to bring you great fortune… BUT HUUUUUUUUNNNNNAY… This is not the time.. put the sheet back on the shelf.. right the heck back now cuz I’m not going to let u be as mad as I am at 3am when your toddler is refusing to sleep and he decides to start banging this garbage on my dang’on tile floors 🤦🏾‍♀️🙄🙈.Don’t say I didn’t warn ya *azz* 🙃

review_text: VERY DISAPPOINTED.I was very disappointed. I had shopped early for my granddaughters birthday present.  I found this great deal on Amazon for a refurbished Leap Frog learning toy for toddlers.  I felt confident that everything would work and be fine only to find out this weekend when I gave the present to her that the screen will not stay flipped to the correct side when the toy is open. Very sad to have to take a toy away from a toddler.  I would have thought that these things would be checked out before reselling a used item. I was sure it would have been sanitized and looked over for defects. Now I see I cannot even return it because the return date has passed.

Poor product design for infants and toddlers in my opinion.

review_text: Screen doesn’t stay upright.Like most parents bought this for my child for Christmas. One min it’s fine next screen wouldn’t work like it suppose to. I pulled it apart looked up YouTube as well to see if their was a difference. I notice the company changed out some parts that looked different. What I notice was the hook where you would lift up the laptop up. I believe that pops off and that’s the problem, I could be wrong all I know it’s very annoying problem. So if you do purchase this just be on the look out this might happen n be ready to return or save your receipt.

review_text: PARENTS BE AWARE OF MUSIC MODE.I have to write this review on my laptop however I am warning all parents of the music mode touch screen. As parents know children soak things up as a sponge soaks up water. They have big imaginations and tend to emulate what they see. I am big on a child remaining as a child and not being a raunchy adult. There is a clip in which I as a parent and most parents who actually care to raise their children properly would disagree with as being child friendly. In music mode as you are touching the music keys scout will dance and one of those dances involves shaking of the rump which is very inappropriate for a 2 year old a 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 10 etc. Thats not what a child should be engaged in and its a huge violation in my opinion. Yes its a great tool to help them learn but be vigilant because if not monitored could easily introduce vulgar and inapropriate movements in your child. Not surprising considering Netflix and cuties and now people trying to force children to make adult decisions at school..... Ima leave it there...

review_text: Kids Who Use Real Technology Will Have Zero Interest.My 4 year old sees me working on my laptop all of the time and she loves to mimic me. At 4 years old I'm not ready to buy her a laptop or even a chromebook yet. I though this would be a great way to allow her to play pretend while also learning with an interactive toy. The problem is, she had absolutely no interest in it. To be fair, she uses a Kindle Fire and has an old iPhone, which are obviously more advanced than this product. However, I thought the laptop style of it would at least pique and keep some of her interest. She literally played with it for five minutes and told me she didn't want it. Her 5 year old sister has a chromebook so she has no interest in it either. May be good for kids who are not used to modern devices but if your child is accustomed to any type of modern tablet/phone/etc. it is doubtful this product will hold their interest at all. It's difficult to use and a bit outdated.
_text: Kids Who Use Real Technology Will Have Zero Interest.My 4 year old sees me working on my laptop all of the time and she loves to mimic me. At 4 years old I'm not ready to buy her a laptop or even a chromebook yet. I though this would be a great way to allow her to play pretend while also learning with an interactive toy. The problem is, she had absolutely no interest in it. To be fair, she uses a Kindle Fire and has an old iPhone, which are obviously more advanced than this product. However, I thought the laptop style of it would at least pique and keep some of her interest. She literally played with it for five minutes and told me she didn't want it. Her 5 year old sister has a chromebook so she has no interest in it either. May be good for kids who are not used to modern devices but if your child is accustomed to any type of modern tablet/phone/etc. it is doubtful this product will hold their interest at all. It's difficult to use and a bit outdated.

review_text: Nothing compared to old version.Out of all the leapfrog products to buy, I would not buy this one. To be fair to the product, I must reveal most of my dissatisfaction is from comparing it to the old version of this toy. I bought the old version used, it came programmed with a name already, no big deal, had the usb to change to my little girls name, or so I thought. I plugged it into my computer and the software for this product, conveniently had been discountined. I was a little frustrated with that fact, but I saw they had made a new version and I was more than happy to spend any amount of money on it. My little girl loved the old version of this toy and I LOVED the personalization, it said your child’s name so many times, it even had emails that you could have personalized with your child’s name and 3 family members! It also had a song of your child’s name. Similar to the violet plush toy, but even more personalized. Now comes this piece of crap, you program your child’s name into it alright, once, you program it into the first letter of their name, when they press it it’ll say “that’s the first letter of your name” and spells it. It literally only spells it, it doesn’t even SAY it. Shame on you leapfrog, as a parent with a child with autism, who is constantly looking for ways to teach her to say her name, the old software/toy was going to be perfect. This “personalization” on this new toy is cheap and lazy and ridiclous.
_text: Nothing compared to old version.Out of all the leapfrog products to buy, I would not buy this one. To be fair to the product, I must reveal most of my dissatisfaction is from comparing it to the old version of this toy. I bought the old version used, it came programmed with a name already, no big deal, had the usb to change to my little girls name, or so I thought. I plugged it into my computer and the software for this product, conveniently had been discountined. I was a little frustrated with that fact, but I saw they had made a new version and I was more than happy to spend any amount of money on it. My little girl loved the old version of this toy and I LOVED the personalization, it said your child’s name so many times, it even had emails that you could have personalized with your child’s name and 3 family members! It also had a song of your child’s name. Similar to the violet plush toy, but even more personalized. Now comes this piece of crap, you program your child’s name into it alright, once, you program it into the first letter of their name, when they press it it’ll say “that’s the first letter of your name” and spells it. It literally only spells it, it doesn’t even SAY it. Shame on you leapfrog, as a parent with a child with autism, who is constantly looking for ways to teach her to say her name, the old software/toy was going to be perfect. This “personalization” on this new toy is cheap and lazy and ridiclous.

Will be returning this item.

review_text: Not tough enough for little kids..This laptop was a big hit with my kids and their cousins (ages 2.5 - 4.5), especially the touch screen feature. However, this toy was not tough enough for them, because it broke after one weekend of play. It only turns on when the screen is turn diagonally now (which means you can't play it!). My 1 year old has also had his hand stuck in this contraption a few times since you can flip the screen into a tablet so I would not recommend this for a younger child.

_text: Lots of options.For the money, there are lots of options. The touch screen works, but the images are hard to see and interpret for little babies. One game makes them select a hair brush? Oops.But again, for $18 to distract a baby on a long road trip, it’ll do. I’ll just have to make sure he doesn’t have the game when he really needs to know his letters the RIGHT way.

review_text: good beginner.This is fun for a 2-3 year old however the screen is a bit dark so it's kind of hard to see Scout the dog. They need to brighten up the graphics. If you are outside or in bright light they wont be able to see the screen.

review_text: For ok life kids who can know their letters.Not many games.  Just push a letter and the laptop says the letter back and screen shows an animal jumping around.  I did feel that much fun would come from this for a younger child who died not even recognize a letter or number.  Would not be able to create a text when not able to identify letters.  Once a child is able to do this i feel it would provide minimal fun.  I was hoping for more interactive games to teach.  Exp:  game shows a letter and encouraged the child to find it, push button, then see the animal jump and hear sounds.  Good level of voice on machine.  Just not interactive or teaching

review_text: Good, but.We like the leapfrog tablet but it appears that there are some slight improvements that could/should be made. the numbers are good until it gets to 10, which is listed as 01.the screen also doesn’t stay in one place in laptop mode, it’d be better if we could get it to not rotate at the slightest change.

review_text: You can’t mute for meetings.There should be a mute feature.

review_text: So much potential hurt by usability.There are so many great things about this toy, but a few key drawbacks make it almost unusable.1. Contrast is terrible. It’s so difficult to see the images on the screen through the touch sensors. Worse, there’s no obvious use case for the touchscreen which doesn’t even seem to work. So it’s a stupid design since the kid can barely see what’s happening. The LCD lets too much of the blue light through the pixels… like watching a dark movie on a bad LCD TV.2. Volume only has two settings.

review_text: Great learning toy but...My 2 year old loved this toy so much. Everything it had to offer was great. Even when he wasn’t playing with it he would repeat the things he learned from it throughout the day. Unfortunately, it just stopped working without warning less than a month after purchasing it (wasn’t the batteries). Because he loved it so much, he was that much more devastated when it wouldn’t work. It was a amazing toy while it lasted but I’m not sure if I would replace it. Don’t really want to go through that again and by the looks of other reviews; this doesn’t seem like a rare occurrence.

I frantically had to go out and buy another gift. I ended up buying another present and then some dry erase markers and I cleaned this up and gave her son the book too. That’s the only reason I didn’t return it. This was supposed to be new not used. Disappointing.

review_text: Could be better.When I saw the letter tracing pages, I assumed it would detect how the letters where written and respond with feedback. Unfortunately, it's not that sophisticated. More importantly, it's really confusing how to use it properly. The instructions are useless, and we still haven't figured out how to properly engage some of the pages. There are a lot of learning materials out there, and even better ones from Leap Frog. My 4yr old can get the same lessons from books themed to his favorite Cars movie, so he prefers to use that. I have no doubt some kids will find this useful, but this just wasn't for us.
_text: Could be better.When I saw the letter tracing pages, I assumed it would detect how the letters where written and respond with feedback. Unfortunately, it's not that sophisticated. More importantly, it's really confusing how to use it properly. The instructions are useless, and we still haven't figured out how to properly engage some of the pages. review_text: Extremely Disappointed! Inferior Quality, Short Warranty.I purchased the VTech Touch and Learn Activity Desk Deluxe from Amazon in September 2025, and I regret it. Initially, the product worked fine, but after the batteries ran out and I replaced them with new ones, the unit completely stopped working. Despite multiple attempts using fresh, high-quality batteries, the product remains non-functional.What frustrates me even more is VTech’s response. I contacted customer support, only to find out that their warranty lasts for just 90 days from the purchase date. To put that in perspective, other toy manufacturers offer 1-year warranties, which clearly shows that VTech doesn't stand behind the long-term durability of their products. This is a glaring issue that speaks volumes about the quality—or lack thereof—of their products.It’s unacceptable that a product, which is marketed as a durable and fun educational tool for children, can stop working so soon after the warranty expires. VTech is clearly not committed to customer satisfaction or product longevity, and this short warranty period only confirms my concerns about the overall reliability of their products.I highly do not recommend this product to anyone, especially if you're looking for a long-lasting, reliable toy. My experience with the VTech Touch and Learn Activity Desk Deluxe has been a major disappointment, and I am now left with a defective product and no recourse from the company.

My experience with the VTech Touch and Learn Activity Desk Deluxe has been a major disappointment, and I am now left with a defective product and no recourse from the company.

review_text: Lots of plastic for very little entertainment or education.First impression: kid mashes buttons, each one tries to speak (eg) “This is… The letter… R”. But the kid mashes buttons fast enough that it doesn’t ever get to say what letter was pressed, it’s too busy painstakingly saying “This is…. the letter….”Second impression, with the music activity pad:There are only seven notes, not a full octave?? The instrument buttons don’t change the voice of the keys, they just say the name of the instrument? This is worse than the Sesame Street piano I had in the 80s.

review_text: This is about when we stop buying their products.This particular product they claim, has cartridges that you can buy separately lol yeah, good luck finding them.And this company is guilty of racial blindness and cultural and gender appropriation: you cannot chose the gender of the kid in the activity pages, even when you buy the pink one and they come with it.. the sheets include animals not found on the continent they’re sold for, and it has rap and rock on their music sheet..They’ve yet to come up with customizable anything for anything.. and the above problems only get worse from here.. where you can’t chose the story packs, and get all kinds of stories from other cultures, or your own cultures stories are watered down or changed, to make them more “global”.. so no one ends up with what they want as they try to pander to everyone.. ridiculous

review_text: NO PRODUCT HONOR.Brought this item for my granddaughter.  After 7 months the product stopped working.  Reached out to Amazon,  since the return window closed, they wouldn't honor a return.  Referred me to the manufacturer.  Contacted Vtech, wouldn't honor a replacement or refund citing the warranty period had expired.  Most items I've purchased usually carry at least a one year product warranty.  This item is only 7 months old.  This is the worst way to keep customers,  not standing behind your product.  I will never again buy from Vtech and considering stopping business with Amazon.  Being Prime customers doesn't mean much with Amazon.  Word to the wise. Stay away from Vtech products.

review_text: Doesn’t work.I bought this for my daughter’s birthday in March. I’d purchased it in December to put away for her birthday. She got so many presents that we’d put this (along with other toys she received) away to open throughout the year. We just opened this activity table to put it together today. I just put 4 brand new AA batteries in it, and the toy will not turn on. It doesn’t absolutely nothing when pressing the on/off button. I’ve tried different batteries, and triple checked that the batteries were in the correct way. Not user error, it’s manufacturer error. This shouldn’t be broken already right out of the box. And there’s probably nothing I can do since we waited months to open it. Disappointed.

review_text: A button mashing nightmare!.Bought this to further enhance my sons ability to differentiate numbers, letters and colors. The problem is the buttons are so sensitive and doesn’t give a chance to finish speaking before the next button is pushed. Meaning if my son mashes every button one right after the other the speaker will start to say every button pushed. Gets annoying really quickly. I just took out the batteries because this is just another stupid noisy toy with no real educational value. Waste of money in my opinion.

review_text: Horrible customer service- DO NOT BUY.We purchased an Explore and Write Activity Desk for our daughters for Christmas. Unfortunately, when installing the desk we put the shoulders on the opposite facing direction. The valve seems one way and we can’t figure out how to uninstall.We called the 1-800 number and were shocked to hear that there was nothing we you could do and no way to help us with our issue. No form of relief in instructions, nor was a replacement part was offered.  I was told to go to the retailer and perhaps they’d be more helpful. This is a brand new desk that my daughters were excited to play with but will apparently never be able to use.When I looked back at the instructions again to see if I was just distracted by children while installing, the instructions are incredibly vague and give no warning to this potential installation issue.This is incredibly disappointing customer service. I’ll be taking my daughters to get a replacement toy…but it will not be a vtech product.

review_text: Absolute piece of garbage.Not sturdy at all. The prices are not connected they are just sort of free floating.  So it comes apart constantly. Just had the main desk part fall off onto my foot, instantly bruising while moving it. The stool comes apart immediately so my tiny 2 year old lifts it to move it and the legs fall off. It’s super loud and annoying with little educational benefit. It’s just one of those noisy garbage space wasters that the Montessori method admonish. Probably gonna just sell it at my next garage sale. It’s useless. Waste of money. Id return it but bought it for black Friday and gave it to my daughter in January. Past the return window. Never been so disappointed before.

review_text: Dislike everything about this.My 2.5 yr old got this for a gift…she dislikes it…and I really dislike it. Not sure where to begin. The sounds are annoying, the phone thing doesn’t seem to work and the biggest problem is…the buttons are too sensitive so…if she happens to rest her arm or hand on the table she is inadvertently holding down a button or several buttons while she is trying to press other buttons…so it will just say the same incorrect word/words over and over and over again…”head, head, head he-he-he-head, this is my head head ar-arm arm head.” I mean, what on earth is a child going to learn from that? I get it that most electronic kids toys have a similar issues…but this one for me was worse bc the toy has almost zero redeeming qualities. Also, the bottom of the legs of the desk and stool slip on the floor so it’s not safe. It’s was also tricky to assemble when it comes to the desk snapping into place…and now it won’t snap out of place so I can break it down and return it. I hate this thing with a royal passion and I just want it out of my house.

review_text: It stopped working after a month..This item was given to my 3 year old son by my sister for his 3rd birthday last year summer from Amazon. It was great for few weeks until one day, he spilled something by accident on it, I wiped it down, but the stuff just stopped working just like that. We even air dried it outside and changed the batteries, but the item still refused to work. My 3 year old has been frustrated ever since, crying. Hoping that I could make it start working again. It does not last I guess or we got a defective item.I bought this item again this year and it has stopped working as well. I don’t know what is wrong with this product. It is very unfair that I bought it again for my son and it has stopped working already.

review_text: Fall Hazard.We bought this for my 2 year old grand daughter and the seat is small, even for her tiny bottom, and hard for her to sit on. She has fallen off of it several times. The hard plastic legs don't work well on a hard floor. They slide too easily so it is best to set it on carpet or a rug. The activity cards work well enough but, if she pushes too hard on a picture, as toddlers will do sometimes, the table will slide away from her. Again, hard floors don't work well with the slick plastic. The table and chair are just not very sturdy. Not a good purchase in my opinion.

review_text: It's ok.This desk is ok. You don't get anything to write with on it. I wish the storage was better for the top sheets when not using them. The shelf needs to be a little longer. It's an ok toy for the price, but I probably would have gone with an actual desk. Storage between the lid and the shelf is small. Also, the little buckets can only fit a few crayons or pencils, and they get caught by the lid when you open and close it, breaking the crayons in half. The kids had fun drawing on the activity cards with their markers, so I can't return the product, but I will not recommend to buy, and I will not buy again.

review_text: Hard for 2-year-olds to understand you can't pound on table.I'm not sure how long this product will last.  It comes with a warning to only touch one spot at a time on, what I assume is, a circuit board.  My main reason for getting it was the art easel and the other brand I intended to buy was not recommended for a 2-year-old, so I decided to buy one that was.  When it arrived my husband and I played with the educational circuit board section for an hour.  We loved it, but when we gave it to our grandson, at 2, he doesn't understand you can't rest your palms on 4 letters at a time or bang on 6 instruments.  We'll see, but I suspect it's going to be an expensive easel.  Oh and I would never use chalk near that circuit board.

review_text: Was great toy while it lasted (~5 months).I bought this as a birthday present for my son who turned 2 in Feb. He loved it and was eager to use it to learn. Sometime around the middle of the year, he stopped playing with it because it became glitchy. After a change of batteries, it was still glitchy. It seems the switch that toggles between music and activity mode isn't making proper contact and it rapid cycles between the two modes, announcing it every time it changes--very annoying, as you can imagine. The warranty was only for 3 months so no help from the manufacturer. Nearly 50 bucks spent for an item that now does not perform the primary function for which it was purchased. Glad I didn't buy any additional activity cards or cartridges for it.

My kids were interested in it, played with it, but now 7 months later it is just sitting, collecting dust, and is in the way. I don't think we will be buying more VTech toys in the future.

review_text: It won't shut up!!!.We got this desk because my son wouldn't share with his sister. I should have gotten the one like his in pink. This desk is annoying! It's cool if you always forget to turn off things or your not watching your kids because as soon as they walk away, it constantly repeats its self. Great educational toy and a slight step up from the older one. It's bigger too. Cards are not interchangeable. (I knew this beforehand and it works for me because the kids can't fight over the cards). The side holders are in shapes instead of an open trough. Which is a bummer because things get stuck in the shapes and they are hard to clean too. Lastly, the darn legs keep falling off the stool. Will have to glue them on.

review_text: Interactive table.I loved that this table was very quick and easy to put together. It is bright and easy and has lots of interactive activities from music to counting numbers, to alphabet letters and sounds. There are two ready set learn sheets that slide on to the table for additional activities, however it may not be the best for 4 year old toddlers as after two months the slides no longer can be read by the table. The table is still fully functional with other parts being fully interactive but the slide sheets no longer work.

review_text: V Tech Touch and learn activity desk deluxe..The activity desk is just what I ordered. V Tech could have done a better job at making it, in my opinion. It's very sensitive, for one. For two, it doesn't shut off automatically. Therefore, you have to continuously get up and turn it off when the baby turns it on, but turns around and walks off because he/she changed their mind and wants to play with something else. Another thing is, where it looks like a play phone is supposed to go, there is a hole there. It looks as though something is supposed to connect there, but nothing came with it, to connect there.

review_text: Perfect gift to torment parents..Are you looking for a gift to torment parents but feel that a full drum set is too obvious?  Well do I have a gift idea for you.The volume control is on the front and to the full discretion of the children.  You might be surprised to learn that the volume down button is not very popular.  There is zero tactical feedback letting them know they are unintentionally touching different buttons on the table and do not seem to care the audio response is constantly repeating that no, that was not the correct letter of the alphabet that was requested.  And because the table is so positve and encouraging to the children, there is seemingly no end to the full volume incorrect responses.

review_text: Unsafe stool.The legs on the stool fall out easily making the stool unsafe for children around the age of 3 who are simply playing with it and are not aware of the dangers of the loose legs. My son has gotten hurt a several times after having moved the stool closer to the desk and wasn't aware a leg fell out in the process and when he sat down, the stool collapsed under him, once causing him to fall face first into the desk. Frustrating because he likes the desk and I never expect the legs on the stool to be an issue.

review_text: Fun for kids but dangerous on non carpeted floors..The table its self is good and has alot of features that my 2 year old son enjoys. But be careful if you have wood floors. The table and chair have nothing on the bottom of the legs to prevent it from slipping on non carpeted floors. The first time my son tried to sit down the chair slid out from underneath him and he fell hitting his head on the floor. If you plan on buying this get some non slip pads to stick on the bottom of the legs to prevent your children from being hurt.

review_text: Better for children over 3 years..I was really excited to give this to my toddler, but even though he seems to be enjoying it, I’m frustrated by how finicky it is.For example, when he’s playing the search game for the alphabet and he has to find the letter S, if he doesn’t press exactly in the middle of the letter box, it either doesn’t do anything, or it thinks he’s pressing the letter beside or beneath S. I don’t like that he’s choosing the right letter and being told he got it wrong, it doesn’t seem like that’s going to help him learn.And I wish the phone part came away from the backboard like the letter writing part does. Because when he’s trying to play “phone a friend”, if he accidentally puts his hand on the board and touches a letter when he’s reaching over to touch the numbers on the keypad, it ends the “phone a friend” game and he has to start all over again.He’s only 2 yrs 9 months, so hopefully as he gets older he’ll be better able to avoid accidentally touching letters while using the phone toy, and he’ll be able to more precisely press the letters on the board so that they actually work.

I don’t like that he’s choosing the right letter and being told he got it wrong, it doesn’t seem like that’s going to help him learn.And I wish the phone part came away from the backboard like the letter writing part does. Because when he’s trying to play “phone a friend”, if he accidentally puts his hand on the board and touches a letter when he’s reaching over to touch the numbers on the keypad, it ends the “phone a friend” game and he has to start all over again.He’s only 2 yrs 9 months, so hopefully as he gets older he’ll be better able to avoid accidentally touching letters while using the phone toy, and he’ll be able to more precisely press the letters on the board so that they actually work.

review_text: Good BUT Also REALLY Bad!.I bought this for my daughter about 3 years ago along with Learn to Read expansion pack so if have it on hand when she was at the age and ready to start learning to read. She is 4 years old now and still plays with this table and the little chair is something she uses on a daily basis to either sit a the tabel with or mainly she uses it as a step stool to reach the sink to wash her hands or the counter to help me cook (use your own Judy as a parent as to whether your child can use this to stand on). While the table has always worked and my daughter still plays with it to this day and learned from it, there is a HUGE disappointment to it. The extra Expansion Pack I bought with it back when I first purchased the table about 3 years ago, it DOES NOT WORK!! 😡😡😡 I didn't think to check to see if it worked with and was comparable with the table back when I first bought it because IT SAYS IT WAS! So now I have a useless pack that my daughter should now be able to use and wants to so bad, but she can't because it's absolutely useless and not compatible with the table like it should be. Wish I could get my money back but it's obviously been way to long.

review_text: Independent modules are a fatal flaw with design.Great idea except the need to insert activity cards to work correctly... you as a parent will be constantly looking for the modules or you will constantly hear "incorrect module, please insert the correct module" leaving your little one confused....

review_text: Buttons are WAY too sensitive.I hoped to get this for my daughter so we could make it fun for her to learn. The features and functionality is great and she enjoys it but for all the wrong reasons.Don't get me wrong. I think this is a great little educational toy. But there is one issue I'm having with it that just turned it into a desk (for now). The issue is that it is very sensitive. Extremely slight pressure (think how sensitive a touch screen is) will set off any of the buttons.As a result it just sounds like an auctioneer with a child's voice in my living room just going off. She enjoys laughing at the crazy sounds that come out of it as a result but not in anyway educating her. We've just turned it off for the time being and will try again when she's a little more dexterous.

review_text: Slipping/falling hazard for little mats included.Although I love this item I will give it three stars because my daughter slipped twice already on one of the little mats. It’s such a great toy and it tells you when the battery is low. It would be great if it didn’t come with the little mats that go on the table because when my daughter dropped one on the floor she stepped on it and slipped on it. Luckily I was able to catch her once, she almost did the splits :( the other time I wasn’t near enough to catch her and she fell pretty bad. For the manufacturer making this, you should try not to add these as they are someone if a slipping hazard even to an adult if they step on it and slip.

review_text: Very dangerous features!!.I think it COULD have been a good product. We really like leapfrog, so this tablet was very disappointing. There is a full internet browser on this thing that kids can access AND a camera. If you are avoiding a regular tablet based on safety concerns, do not buy this product. Why on earth does this thing have full internet access? HUGE miss on Leapfrog’s part. Also, you are prompted upon startup to purchase the Academy membership. Amazon offered a partial refund to keep the tablet and I declined. Absolutely not worth it. Protect the children and don’t buy these kinds of things.

review_text: Tacky Wacky Jacky- Product worked for a little bit.Bought this product in January. The item stopped working by August. Would not hold a charge. Contacted LeapFrog who extends a year warranty in their products. They tell me that Wacky Jacky is an unauthorized seller so they would not extend the warranty to me. I call a Wacky Jacky and Wacky Jacky said the leap pad only had a 30 day warranty! Needless to say. Just by the product from the official site. No one was helpful. And read the seller information on Amazon.

review_text: Freezes Constantly – Total Waste of Money.I haven’t even had the LeapFrog LeapPad Academy Tablet for a full month, and the issues started almost immediately. From the very first uses, it lagged so badly that it would freeze up completely. Apps take forever to open, the screen becomes unresponsive, and my child gets frustrated and doesn’t even want to use it anymore. This was supposed to be a fun and educational tool, but it’s basically unusable. For the price, I expected much better. Extremely disappointed.

review_text: No built in learning apps. Charged for all apps.I'm irritated thinking it would come with installed learning apps. It charged me for subscription that I assumed would grant me access to the learning apps. All apps appear to be over $10 and I haven't purchased any yet to confirm if they've included a safeguard to keep your child from making future purchases. Tried to get around iPad app charges but could have just let him keep using my iPad and paid for the $3 games on it.  Total deception and rip off if you ask me, but now I have it. I'll see how it works, if he likes and decide if I will have it returned

review_text: Poorly Made - Terrible Customer Service From LeapFrog.I would give it 0 stars if possible. I purchased this for my 3 year old granddaughter for Christmas. She dropped it on Sunday & cracked the screen. It turns on but the touch screen does not work. It has a two year manufacturer’s warranty. I called Amazon & since the 30 day warranty was up (she has had it 2 months) they could not help me but gave me LeapFrog’s 800 number. I called them and a cracked screen voids the manufacturer’s warranty. 😳 They even put me on hold and checked with a Supervisor.  Seriously? Amazon told me it was covered. 🤷‍♀️ This product is recommended for 3-8 year olds; they are going to drop it. If the screen cracks that easily they need to make the product better.My recommendation is not to purchase this product because it is not make well enough to withstand a drop from a 3 year old. Leapfrog needs to honor their manufacturer’s warranty because I will never purchase another product they make - ever again.

review_text: FREEZES CONSTANTLY.I bought this for my nephew and it freezes ALL the time. Constantly! he hasn’t even downloaded anything extra on it besides what comes with it, so at this point we are worried if it will even work if we try. It is not worth this high price! when it freezes it’s not for a few seconds but sometimes 5 or 10 minutes. And it freezes everything few minutes of the reaction time to clicking buttons is very very delayed. way way too frequently for it to even be functional. I wish I never bought. I will search for something else!

review_text: NOT WORTH THE HEADACHE.So, I originally bought this for a 12-hour road trip to Canada for my 3-year-old.I purchased this tablet thinking she would love it while also getting more benefits from the educational aspect. However, not even 30 minutes of usage, she was throwing tantrums due to the screen lag. At that point, she didn't bother to use it for the remainder of the trip. For this reason, I ended up returning it.During the setup, I decided to try the “90-day trial” for more apps as there isn't much offered without the additional subscription. Unfortunately, it was late at night and I mistakenly made an error while entering my email. After returning from my trip the subscription was supposedly cancelled, and the tablet was restored to the factory and returned. To my surprise, months later I’m still getting charged!?I reached out to Leapfrog customer service and no one could help due to the wrong email! I have provided the order #, phone number, the tablet’s serial #, card number that was being charged and still “they can't find any account with that information”. After multiple attempts at solving the issue with Leapfrog, I decided to go through my bank to dispute the charges. They kept $30 for the first charge, at this point I have up. At least I got back my other 4 charges of $30.Everything was fine until now. Apparently, I’m being charged again because I “resubscribed”. How is this even possible when I haven’t had the tablet for months!?

review_text: Internet connected money-hungry vessel for apps/subscriptions.This device needs apps and subscriptions. This is just a vessel for apps… not the leapfrog self-contained learning devices my kids have come to know and love. review_text: False Advertising.Soooo disappointed in this product. I checked on this product for months waiting for it to go on sale. Finally we got it at a decent price and saved it for Christmas. My daughter used in ONE time, dropped it not even a foot off the ground and it shattered the screen. Its totally unusable now and the seller will not replace.I waited to purchase when this product was on sale, so now we have to flat out return because paying and extra $40 on an item that broke immediately is out of the question. It's almost cruel that my daughter got to play with it once, it breaks and now she wont have the LeapPad at all. Amazon wont replace the product because the seller does not give that as an option. Very disappointed in the seller advertising false information and with Amazon for allowing it.This product does not have a "shatter-safe LCD screen to protect from drops and falls."

review_text: Scratched Screen!.I am unable to upload a photo, most likely because it is a downloaded photo from my daughter. We gifted this to my grandson for Christmas & he loves it. However, after using it for an hour or two, the screen was terribly scratched. He is almost 5, is not destructive with his toys, & had supervision. Upon inspection, my daughter saw the stylus had metal exposed which caused it to scratch the screen. I messaged LeapFrog & was told I should have contacted them to replace they stylus before it damaged the screen. I didn't realize I had to inspect a new product prior to use to ensure it wasn't defective! Very disappointed!

review_text: Learning Games Not Included- Monthly Cost.We don't do devices for our children. We finally decided this would be a fun way to include some technology use with learning games. We didn't realize that the learning academy was a separate cost (monthly). I was under the impression it was pre-downloaded games to encourage learning. The only things included are the typical, mindless, addictive time waisters. If you desire learning games, that will be a minimum $6 a month. Very disappointed as it was a birthday gift my child was excited to receive.

review_text: Disappointed.I bought 2 Leap Frog.. LeapPad Academy for Kids Learning Tablet Green.One for a 4 year old and one for a 6 year old. Christmas presents 2023. I bought age appropriate subscriptions.  The one for the 4 year old stopped working around March 2024.  The one for the 6 year old bored her. She uses an regular IPAD and her mother loaded appropriate learning apps. Much better investment. The subscriptions automatically renew a year  after your initial sign up date . One must make sure to flag the renewal  date, if not satisfied, so you can cancel the subscription.

review_text: Stops Working.We bought this 9 months ago.  Honestly, we have not used it very regularly (sometimes it's months before we turn it back on), and we have taken good care of it.  Now it won't even turn on.  We have tried all of the troubleshooting suggests on the website.  I guess I'll have to contact LeapFrog now.  I'm super disappointed in this product.  I was already disappointed in the lack of games you can download to it compared to past LeapFrog tablets we've had, and now it doesn't even work.  I do not recommend buying this for your child.  You would be better off buying one of the older tablets used.

review_text: I'm practically the only one who hates this thing.The graphics are old and outdated; just a not so nice looking screen.It's someone slow and you have to tap in weird places to get to certain screens. You have to tap and go through several prep screens to get to certain games. Sometimes you click the name, sometimes you click the door. It's just tedious and studpid.The battery is very short. Even worse: the battery continues to drain even if you have powered it off. It must be returned to the charger every single time.Some of the games and apps are just horrible. No extra levels, no rewards. Not really games or puzzles. It's like you do this one task and then you are done in 20 seconds and have to go back to the prior screen because it's done. Why did we take 40 seconds to load this "game" and then 40 seconds to go back to the prior screen, after a 20 second game.We are at the first grade level. This leapfrog tablet sucks so bad. I can't believe the high reviews.Also, don't think you'll be able to simply go and find a game that appeals to you because it will just sit there forever and ever downloading. It's so slow.

review_text: Stopped working once it was past the return date.I bought this for my son right before Christmas. review_text: Glitches and Stops Working.I bought this back in July for our son. He was so excited. He played with it for a couple of months and then it started turning off by itself, the screen would glitch and it would turn off. Finally it stopped turning on at all. I contacted Leapfrog and they said I need to replace it. They will not do anything to help because I apparently didn't buy it from an authorized seller. I bought it from Amazon directly from the leapfrog store. Watch out because they will send it to you from Amazon but the "seller" will never be Leapfrog. Thereby relieving Leapfrog of any warranty fixes/replacement. Such a scam. Don't buy.

review_text: TERRIBLE!!.Do not purchase this pad for your toddler it is terrible. I don't know what the problem is but it does not power on for long and takes FOREVER to charge! I could tell it was sent back because the box it came in appeared to have already be opened! It may be defective but was defiantly sold to me! I couldn't get a shipping label in time to get my money refunded back so I'm here to warn you .... DONT BUY IT! Get a regular tablet and just down load cocomelon, baby shark, and other learning apps for your kids with it because this isnt it! And dont get me started on the ridiculous subscription .... I'm paying for something my baby cant even use. When I finally got the tablet to come on I had to purchase more items for her to add on to play. Why? if I have a subscription it should cover it? Waste of money. Dont buy this!!

review_text: LeapFrog LeapPad Academy Kids’ Learning Tablet.I’ve bought several other Leapfrog learning activity toys for my grandson.  Other devices have onlyBlack & White displays with VERY POOR resolution.  This has a larger, color display.  It is a great improvement over other products.  It also includes a rechargeable battery.  As all their products it can take punishment w/o breaking.  It includes some basic activities but a lot of activities requires additional payment for a fee.  Toddler should be at least 3 yrs old.  Can’t recommend as by the time a child can fully use you would be better off buying a used iPad or similar product.

review_text: Beware for younger kids.Far too fragile for the younger age range crowd. I was using my thumbnail and barely putting pressure to scrape some kid gunk off of the screen. We all know what that's like, and it cracked in three places. It won't work now. My daughter got this on Easter and she's only played with it. Maybe six times. She's only younger and so she doesn't get to play in discriminately, but it should be more robust than this for this price. I love the idea of the tablet that it's leapfrog learning products that you can download apps for them I like that much better for her than the Fire tablet but ultimately I would say spend the extra money and go for the fire tablet. The only reason it gets two stars is because it fit what I was looking for all except the quality.

review_text: Wouldn’t recommend.The media could not be loaded.My son had an iPad but got this as a gift. I was excited because it would focus on learning and cut out all the extra stuff like Roblox. But he’s had it out of the box for 20 minutes and it’s already had multiple issues. It lags horribly but is up to date on the software, it freezes up and doesn’t recognize any touch & does that for a few minutes & now it’s stuck on a blank settings screen because we are trying to hook it up to WiFi. Save your money and go with a better tablet.

It lags horribly but is up to date on the software, it freezes up and doesn’t recognize any touch & does that for a few minutes & now it’s stuck on a blank settings screen because we are trying to hook it up to WiFi. review_text: Two purchases in less than a year and half: Charging doesn't last over a year.We purchased the first one (Walmart) June 2023 while moving states. Within 4 months, we noticed it needed charged more than when first bought. The port seem to not hold the cord well as began to "wiggle" when plugged in. Also noticed the lagging in the apps and seem to slow down in response time. By November 2023, it would not charge.Purchased again (Amazon) December 2023. Within 6 months, noticed lagging again and needed more charge time even though he was on it less.  As of December into Jan 2025 (a year later), the port, again, has failed as well.Only adults are allowed to charge it. No damage etc. Two purchases with the same end results. I have found other on-line reviews, and school community reviews with similar issues.We will not re-purchase.

review_text: The device works.The device is in working order but the seal was broken on the box and the 3 months free trial card was not in the box. I had to create an account and add a credit card for a plan. 1 month free trial.

review_text: It's okay.Look, it is a durable tablet don't get me wrong, but the stylus is a fabric tip that most kids will either rip or chew off, which then easily scratches the screen. We've had two, and after about a year the same problem pokes it's ugly head, horrible load times and unbearable lag. Do yourself a favor though, you're really only going for the learning academy, which is just a browser based portal, meaning you can literally load it on any device, I've even had it running on a fire stick with Bluetooth m+k. I was genuinely shocked at how much smoother it ran. Oh, and the battery life becomes horrendous after a few months, sometimes even shutting down at about 20%
_text: It's okay.Look, it is a durable tablet don't get me wrong, but the stylus is a fabric tip that most kids will either rip or chew off, which then easily scratches the screen. We've had two, and after about a year the same problem pokes it's ugly head, horrible load times and unbearable lag. Do yourself a favor though, you're really only going for the learning academy, which is just a browser based portal, meaning you can literally load it on any device, I've even had it running on a fire stick with Bluetooth m+k. I was genuinely shocked at how much smoother it ran. Oh, and the battery life becomes horrendous after a few months, sometimes even shutting down at about 20%

review_text: Battery Issues/Power Issues.Bought for my daughter for christmas. The tablet and program itself we love. The issue is the battery/power Issues. Haven't even had it a full month and we are going on our THIRD tablet. I've had to return two due to them not turning on or charging after dying. We plugged it in last night after it died, it was charging, woke up this morning and it won't budge. Just got it as a replacement for the first one yesterday. Same thing happened to the last one, but after a couple weeks. I also noticed things changed from the first tablet to the second we got, stylus is different, different charger. Which shows me they're fixing "issues" already. Too bad they didn't fix the battery. Contacted Leapfrog originally and they told me to just return it and get a replacement where I bought it. Ended up having to pay more because Amazon didn't offer a replacement so I just returned and rebought. Getting sick of having to set up the new tablets all over again and dropping off the broken ones at UPS.

review_text: Nice at first, but doesn’t last..The tablet isn’t the most intuitive to figure out to begin with, but it got a bit better until about two months ago. A year after purchase, the tablet won’t connect to Wi-Fi at all, we’ve done a complete reset on it twice, and it still won’t work. Our son is heartbroken, and it’s a bummer we wasted money on something that didn’t last very long.

review_text: Good brand but hard to reach customer service.Bought 2 of these in November of 2022 as Christmas gifts at the end of that year for my kids. After using one of the 2 and the battery running out, we attempted to charge it and it wouldn't charge. I've tried reaching out to leappad and recieved no help. I tried reaching out to Amazon and they told me to contact leap pad. So now I have one that my child hasn't been able to play since Christmas and no help in getting what happened to it fixed. It's to the point that no one has tried to help me resolve the issue that now I have to pay more money for a place to help me fix it. I should of never had to do that in the first place

review_text: Slow and Unresponsive.Obviously we purchased this item for educational purposes. The tablet seemed to have so much potential. It is impossible for our child to run any of the programs. Not only is it frustrating for us parents, but our child has basically lost all interest because of how poorly it runs.

review_text: Super glitchy.I got this for my 3 year old and was happy to see the upgrade to the case from the last model. It is the interface that is the problem.  It sleeps very quickly which disconnects from the internet which the academy portion needs.  The features and very limited games on the tablet are mostly decorative and not of much use, the Learning Academy is the real use.  You have to subscribe separately for a modest fee.  I can live with that, but not when it takes so long to load and crashes every other game.  They need to knock it off with all of the demos ads and sales pushes for over priced games and stream line this to run the learning academy.  If they did that this would be an easy 4 star item.

review_text: Terminally Underpowered.my 5 year old son and I both love the content on this thing, it really keeps him engaged. the hardware has a lot of trouble keeping up with software, so much so that it's almost unplayable. (and I haven't even downloaded anything yet!) audio and video both consistently lag and stutter and the load times are comparable to 80s PC games on floppy disk (5m, not even joking). really wish there's was a way to fix this =(

review_text: Disappointed.My son received the Leapfrog Academy on Leap Pad as a "big brother" gift. He always wanted our phones and we wanted something educational. The tablet comes with a FEW "demo" games but for my 3 year old he only likes 2. From what I can tell you need to buy the monthly academy. I really wish I would've done more researching. I think we needed the Amazon Fire to download what we wanted.
_text: Disappointed.My son received the Leapfrog Academy on Leap Pad as a "big brother" gift. He always wanted our phones and we wanted something educational. The tablet comes with a FEW "demo" games but for my 3 year old he only likes 2. From what I can tell you need to buy the monthly academy. I really wish I would've done more researching. I think we needed the Amazon Fire to download what we wanted.

review_text: Shockingly  Disappointing.I've been an advocate for LeapFrog products for well over a decade to friends and family. My last child now a toddler was not going to be an exception and we looked forward to giving her the latest version of what LeapFrog had to offer ,the LeapPad Academy Tablet. We got her this for Christmas and I was reallly excited to see what she would be able to make of it as my first two kids , now teens really benefitted from using this in their formative years. Truth be told they had Leapster Explorers and one lasted up till the arrival of the LeapPad.So where is the disappointment you may ask. Well from day one we noticed that the screen proved a bit unreactive at times but we simply put it down to software challenges that work out over time. But naively we were wrong , the problem grew progressively worse to the point where the frustration made my daughter abandon the device. The simplest of strokes wouldn't elicit a response on the screen . Also frustrating has been the WiFi connectivity , its been very inconsistent and drops linkage to the LeapPad academy midgame on a regular basis. In short this turned out to be a nightmare scenario for a bitSome respite came when we switched to run the Leappad Academy from the computer and laptops for her to play the games. She is now rebuilding some desire to play the games as she progresses in a consistent manner using the mouse. She really enjoys the LeapPad Academy and this (initially 3 month free) paid platform  has proven to be  the saving grace. It hasn't assuaged my personal frustration as the whole point of creting an avenue for learning has been disrupted significantly . Which now means I have to acquire a standalone tablet to recreate the experience , or seek out an alternative which defeats the purposeThe two stars are for the software otherwise it would have been much worse.

review_text: Software issues.Bought two of them for my grandkids for Christmas.  We had issues with the software freezing so we would reboot and it would work .  Well it will no longer reboot, so we contacted leapfrog to see if they could assist and we were told they no longer have inventory on this tablet and don’t know if they will.

review_text: Dropped it Once and done.My son enjoyed it up until he dropped it once accidentally and it has yet to work sense. I fixed it once, when the screen went black, yet you could hear it was still playing. I took the back off and fixed that issue. Then a day later it started freezing and i was sick of him yelling about it so now $100 birthday gift sits there. Not happy with the quality of items that are supposed to be made for kids.

review_text: I would pass.I am not impressed with this tablet for multiple reasons. Time based use... this is pointless if you have more than one kid, my 2.5 year old daughter knows to just select her brothers profile when she runs out of time and vice versa. The rubber padding comes off way too easy and is essentially useless. The screen itself is terrible because unless you are directly in front of it, you can't see the screen. The problem with this is if you want to help your kid or see what they are up to, you can't both get a good view... which leads to the other problem if you have more than one kid, they fight over it because they want to watch each other play, but since they can't both see, they end up pulling at it.  Finally with all of those issues, the value is poor due to how expensive the apps are. I am a fan of other leap frog products, but I would stick to a general tablet and free source/better value apps.

review_text: Misleading product.Once we received this device, it seemed very modern and sturdy, new and improved since the older version we had. However, the "free" apps were a total joke, not age appropriate for my 2 year old, and not fun. Without a subscription there is literally no option to download more free apps. Everything was for sale $5-25 each, and a subscription is way more than I'd be willing to pay year after year as mu toddler grows up. Save your money and buy a standard tablet with age appropriate apps, that range from free to $5. Put kids mode on. Cheaper and better, no subscription needed.

review_text: Not worth it.Got a used product like many other people have stated in the review. Learning academy does not work for me. I did the free trial and was not able to download any of the apps that come with the paid subscription. Battery life is horrible.I bought this learning tablet because I did not want to get a traditional iPad or tablet where my child could have access to YouTube and more adult things. That’s the only good thing about this learning tablet. It’s not a traditional one where you can access the Internet.But the games and learning activities that come installed are very laggy and could definitely use an upgrade.Would I buy this again? No. Would I recommend it for people to buy? No.

review_text: Does not stand up to the previous Leap pads, very disappointed.Very nice sleek looking device, but not user friendly. The apps are not labeled on the main screen, paid for and downloaded apps and they will not install nor are they showing in the pending downloads. Also Leappad academy is the only new feature and it asks for your credit card information before you can even see what the app is capable of. Paying an extra $40 for what should be an included app after paying $150 for the device is not cool. We will be returning this device. I am beyond disappointed in Leap Frog this time, every other leap frog device was never this much trouble. Parent Buyer beware!

review_text: Not kid-proof.Love the concept, but does not hold up to kid use. This is our 3rd time purchasing (I wouldn't bother but it's one of the few things my child on the spectrum gets excited about). The 1st time he dropped it outside and it factory reset and stopped working, this time it fell of the kitchen table, shattered and stopped responding. The warranty only covers if you purchase through leapfrog, so we were s.o.l. Great tablet, but needs to be upgraded to withstand child use.

review_text: They keep breaking.I have two autistic children who love this tablet, and I love the educational and easy to use apps, but this is my third time reordering because the tablets stop turning on after a few weeks. review_text: Not Very Consistent.The left picture is of the tablet I received today, and the right is of the replacement I received of the first tablet I bought. I bought one almost a year ago, and the battery eventually wouldn't hold a charge and then stopped working. LeapFrog support sent a new one at no charge, and everything is the same (battery is fine so far) except the new pink one glitches and needs to be restarted a lot. I ordered another one yesterday in green and when I plugged it in and turned it on, the tablet software is completely wrong. This software is for a leappad Epic, and it said such on the internal system info and when the tablet setup was complete. I am disappointed and will have to contact LeapFrog support again.

I wouldn't have so many devices if they wouldn't break. This is the last time I will be buying this product.

review_text: LASTED ONLY TWO MONTHS.The durability in the hands of children within the age limit advertised is about 25%. A parent who makes it a point to always stay with the child when he or she is using it, will get about 60% durability. But what would be the point if it is to engage the children that age group 3 to 8, and you end up staying with them the whole time.Just a little amount of water on the surface of the screen by my child trying to clean it (kids), completely ended the life of the tablet. Return policy was over  January 31, 2020 and it happened January 29, 2020. I bought it November 23, 2020.

review_text: Very disappointing.We had 2 of the older style leap pads and loved them, used for years through multiple kids (still have one that is about 7 years old that works better in every way than the new ones) Bought two of these and the battery life on both was less than an hour. Had them replaced and one of replacements would not charge so got yet another. Battery life is barely one hour on it (the other is about one and a half) and within two months it is no longer charging. This went from being an item I recommended to everyone to one I would suggest avoiding. The games are great so it is very disappointing that the actual tablet is so poorly built.

review_text: Runs Android, but NOT Google Play.Overall this is not a bad kid's tablet.  It is sturdy and comes with a good bumper, stand, and stylist.HOWEVER, where this tablet falls short is its inability to run *actual* android apps.  You cannot download Google Play and trying to go through a mirror does not work either.You can ONLY buy apps from the LeapFrog store.  Which has the most expensive app prices I have ever seen (taking advantage of a captive audience much?).I bought this as a replacement for a broken android tablet, assuming because it was running android that I would be able to install all the apps my kids have gotten used to. BIG NOPE THERE.TLDR; check the prices of the LeapFrog App Store before you buy, if you like their selection and prices, this is the tablet for you.  If you have already purchased a number of Google Play apps and are looking for a new tablet for your kids, avoid this one.

review_text: LeapPad Academy does not accept cartridges.The product was advertised to me on Amazon as a bundle including Frozen.  While the pad construction is of good quality, the games were in cartridge format, which the LeapPad Academy does not accept.  The bundle is a waste of money.If purchasing a LeapPad Academy, or similar, consider waiting for it to arrive and buy the extra games directly from the tablets app store.  At least then, you will be spending your money on something you can use.
_text: LeapPad Academy does not accept cartridges.The product was advertised to me on Amazon as a bundle including Frozen.  While the pad construction is of good quality, the games were in cartridge format, which the LeapPad Academy does not accept.  The bundle is a waste of money.If purchasing a LeapPad Academy, or similar, consider waiting for it to arrive and buy the extra games directly from the tablets app store.  At least then, you will be spending your money on something you can use.

review_text: Kids-ready tablet, but expensive & outdated.I was very excited about this LeapFrog LeapPad tablet for our son to play with. And he does enjoy playing with it. However, for $160 I would only recommend this to someone with no technology inclination whatsoever who wants a ready to go technology toy.Here's why: LeapPad is very easy to set up, comes preloaded with a handful of games and is generally "kid proof" right out of the box.Unfortunately, that's where positives end. The 7" screen is of such poor quality that you have to be looking at it perfectly straight on to avoid distortion. Oh and it's worse in portrait mode than landscape and also worse at higher brightness. The device also runs on top of a very old "neutered" version of Android 4.4. It came out ~6 years ago and Google stopped releasing updates for it (including key *security* updates) almost 5 years ago. Given that this device relies on WiFi connectivity and will likely travel with the child to various WiFi networks (e.g. restaurants, hotels, airports, etc) this device has decent potential to get infected with something nasty and then spread it to other systems. I work in IT Security and a device running Android 4.4 would never be allowed on a corporate network these days.LeapPad does have a web browser and a couple of other regular tablet features in "parent" mode. They are pretty mediocre by today's standards. It also does include a handful of games and they're quite fun but it's pretty clear from using the device that it's really not going to entertain kids for very long and they're really trying to get you to sign up for LeapPad academy ($9.99/mth or a bit less for a yearly subscription).Now, say you accept this cost as the games are quite good. In that case, LeapFrog academy supports a multitude of devices, including Amazon Fire tablets. You can get a new Amazon Fire 7 tablet with a much better screen, dimensions and running a much newer version of Android (7.1 I believe) for $69.99. That $100 you're saving can buy you a super sturdy case for it and almost cover a year of LeapPad academy! And no offense to LeapFrog, but I have a lot of faith in Amazon's application & device security practices. It's going to be much better at being a tablet than LeapPad in every way but is still not running a full version of Android. You can get that full version of Android in a Samsung Galaxy Tab E lite or in a clearance model of a Samsung Galaxy tablet, likely running Android 8 or newer for around $140 - still cheaper than LeapPad. Want to spend even less? Take a look at some well rated "no name" tablets - they can be quite decent.You would then have to set up parental controls on either Amazon Fire or another tablet to make it kid-safe. This is relatively easy to do by following online tutorials but I recognize that this still may be an issue for folks and thus would be the main situation where LeapPad comes out on top.As for me, even though we have this LeapPad already, I don't want it on my Wi-Fi network. I've put it on my guest network for now but we'll likely go down the Amazon Fire 7 route in the future. And I'm thinking that LeapFrog Academy subscription will be worth the money in a few months to get our son to interact with (and learn from) some very well-made educational games!

review_text: Doesn’t work.The media could not be loaded.I purchased this as a Christmas gift at the end of September. When you have multiple kids you know the struggle  of buying everything at once so I start a few months out. Anyway, bought this and it sat in the box until Christmas morning. We opened it and little one was excited to play with it but the top left corner of screen doesn’t work and the screen doesn’t rotate and lock when I laptop mode, making that function useless. Of course, it’s past the return date but it wasn’t opened until Christmas. The leapfrog company said there’s a 90 day warranty but it doesn’t apply because of purchase date. What’s the difference in sitting in my closet and sitting on the shelf? I have photo proof that it was opened on Christmas morning. Anyway- this is the last leapfrog product we will ever purchase. The company’s customer service is awful.

review_text: Impossible to see, completely useless although nice concept.The screen is completely unviewable, first the screen is very reflective which makes it catch light and have high glare, second the contrast of the screen (black LCD over blue-lit background) is so poor that you cannot see anything anyways beyond some vague shapes, third the viewing angle is non-existent - if you move 1 degree up/left/down/right it also completely removes visibility.  Beyond this, the actual concept is nice with 2-in-1 laptop/tablet, children email writing, and songs, but there's not much here that you wouldn't find in almost any other children's toy (maybe like 30-40 permutations of songs/activities/etc) but since you can't see anything anyways, it's much more frustrating for the child than fun and you'll get alot of anger/crying with it.  Definitely DO NOT RECOMMEND.
_text: Impossible to see, completely useless although nice concept.The screen is completely unviewable, first the screen is very reflective which makes it catch light and have high glare, second the contrast of the screen (black LCD over blue-lit background) is so poor that you cannot see anything anyways beyond some vague shapes, third the viewing angle is non-existent - if you move 1 degree up/left/down/right it also completely removes visibility.  Beyond this, the actual concept is nice with 2-in-1 laptop/tablet, children email writing, and songs, but there's not much here that you wouldn't find in almost any other children's toy (maybe like 30-40 permutations of songs/activities/etc) but since you can't see anything anyways, it's much more frustrating for the child than fun and you'll get alot of anger/crying with it.  Definitely DO NOT RECOMMEND.

review_text: Defective product.The media could not be loaded.Read instructions, replaced batteries, and touch screen doesn't work in tablet mode.  There is no touch screen functionality in any of the modes.  It appears to have an air bubble or possibly water under the plastic covering the screen.  There is no removable protective film.I'm also upset that I have to go out of my way to drive to an Amazon return site/partner.  There isn't even a replacement option.  I think my daughter would have enjoyed this but unfortunately I can't recommend the product after this experience.

review_text: Don't waste your money.My son (3) was given this by a family member for Christmas. He was quite excited for it but he became incredibly frustrated by the "messages" feature. The thing asks him to reply to "violet" or "scout" by typing a response. My son can read and write so this is great for him in theory. But the feature is half assed. There is no space button! My son was actually in tears trying to figure out how to put a space between words. Anyone with a toddler knows how easily frustrated they get. I do not blame him here. Why include such a feature if it doesn't work?

review_text: Do NOT buy this sheet!!!!!!!.So look right…... I buy everything before hand.. and I’ve bought this mess on May 20th for my son’s bday on June 21st (keep reading). The return window closed on June 19th (trust me on this.. you’ll want to keep reading!!!!).. the darn screen does the same thing all the videos show up above.. it falls backwards.. this is complete junk I promise.. and they have the audacity to have the contrast level on the screen be horrendous AF, okay.. there’s not making the lettering on the screen any darker (but.. you’re almost there.. keep reading.. or risk being annoyed AF with this purchase)!!! Soooooooo.. now.. that I’m stuck with this piece of trash… because we didn’t open it until after the return window! Now, mind you, I would’ve opened it prior, if it was for myself, but my 3 year old is obsessed with opening all boxes from friggin Amazon (go figure 😡) and we didn’t want to ruin his joy.. soooooo, all in all.. to make a long story short … he bangs this *sheet* on the floor (all day and all night) because he’s *pieced* the heck off, that it’s trash and he complains to me about the screen not working properly🤬 because he knows it’s trash and it annoys him.. which leads him to annoy me!You are free to buy this mess on a hope and prayer that the reviews might be a hit or miss and your luck is destined to bring you great fortune… BUT HUUUUUUUUNNNNNAY… This is not the time.. put the sheet back on the shelf.. right the heck back now cuz I’m not going to let u be as mad as I am at 3am when your toddler is refusing to sleep and he decides to start banging this garbage on my dang’on tile floors 🤦🏾‍♀️🙄🙈.Don’t say I didn’t warn ya *azz* 🙃

review_text: VERY DISAPPOINTED.I was very disappointed. I had shopped early for my granddaughters birthday present.  I found this great deal on Amazon for a refurbished Leap Frog learning toy for toddlers.  I felt confident that everything would work and be fine only to find out this weekend when I gave the present to her that the screen will not stay flipped to the correct side when the toy is open. Very sad to have to take a toy away from a toddler.  I would have thought that these things would be checked out before reselling a used item. I was sure it would have been sanitized and looked over for defects. Now I see I cannot even return it because the return date has passed.
